qahramon

Class Backpack

  • java.lang.Object
    • qahramon.Item
      • qahramon.Backpack
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Container

    public class Backpack
extends Item
implements Container
    A class of backpacks as special kinds of items involving a capacity and content. This class implements the interface 'Container'.
    Version:
    1.0 - 2019
    Author:
    Robin Bruneel, Jean-Louis Carron, Edward Wiels
    Invariants:
  • Each backpack must have a valid capacity.
        isValidCapacity(getCapacity())
  • Each backpack must have proper items.
        hasProperItems()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Backpack(float capacity, float weight, int value)
      Create a backpack with given capacity, weight and value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Backpack

        public Backpack(float capacity,
                float weight,
                int value)
        Create a backpack with given capacity, weight and value.
        Parameters:
        capacity - the capacity of this backpack
        weight - the weight of this backpack
        value - the value of this backpack
        Postcondition:
        The capacity is set to the given capacity.
            new.getCapacity() == capacity
        Effect:
        The backpack is set as an item with given weight and value.
            super(weight, value)

        @Basic
 @Immutable
 @Raw
public boolean isBackpack()
        Check whether this item is a backpack.
        Overrides:
        isBackpack in class Item
        Returns:
        Always return true since this item is a backpack.
            result == true

      • canHaveAsIdentification

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsIdentification(long identification)
        Check whether the given identification is valid.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsIdentification in class Item
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given identification is divisible by two and larger than zero. Return false otherwise.
            result == (identification % 2 == 0 && identification > 0)

      • canHaveAsNewIdentification

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsNewIdentification(long identification)
        Check whether the given identification is valid and unique.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsNewIdentification in class Item
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification to check
        Returns:
        Return true when this backpack can have the given identification number that has to be unique. Return false otherwise.
            result == canHaveAsIdentification (identification)
             && identification == generateIdentification()

      • isValidCapacity

        public static boolean isValidCapacity(float capacity)
        Check whether the given capacity is valid.
        Parameters:
        capacity - the capacity to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given capacity is positive. Return false otherwise.
            result == capacity >= 0

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Item item)
        Check whether the current backpack contains this item.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be checked
        Returns:
        Return true when the current backpack contains this item. Return false otherwise.
            result == containsKey(item.getIdentification())
             && this.getContentAt(item.getIdentification()).contains(item)

      • getNbItems

        @Basic
public int getNbItems()
        Return the number of items in this backpack.
        Returns:
        Return the number of items in this backpack.
            result == getItems().size()

      • canHaveAsTotalWeight

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsTotalWeight(float weight)
        Check whether this backpack can have the given total weight.
        Returns:
        Return true when this backpack can have the new total weight. Return false otherwise.
            result == weight - this.getWeight() <= getCapacity()
             && (getParentBackpack() == null || getParentBackpack().canHaveAsNewWeight(getParentBackpack().getTotalWeight() - this.getTotalWeight() + weight))
             && (getCharacter() == null || getCharacter().getTotalWeight() - this.getTotalWeight() + weight <= getCharacter().getCapacity())

      • canHaveAsItem

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsItem(Item item)
        Check whether this backpack can have an item.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to check
        Returns:
        Return false when the given item is this backpack or the item is terminated or this backpack is terminated. Return false when the item is a purse. Return false when the item is held by another non dead character than the holder of this backpack. Return false when the item can't be picked up by the holder of this backpack. Return false when the given item is a direct or indirect parent backpack of this backpack. Return false when the this backpack can't have the new total weight. of this backpack. Return true otherwise.
            result == !(item == this || this.isTerminated() || item.isTerminated())
             && !(item.isPurse())
             && !(item.getHolder() != null && item.getHolder() != this.getHolder() && item.getHolder().isDead() == false)
                   && !(item.getHolder() == null && this.getHolder() != null && !this.getHolder().canPickUp(item))
             && !(item.isBackpack() && this.isDirectOrIndirectSubBackpackOf((Backpack)item))
                 && (!contains(item) && !canHaveAsTotalWeight(this.getTotalWeight() + item.getWeight()))

      • isDirectOrIndirectSubBackpackOf

        @Raw
public boolean isDirectOrIndirectSubBackpackOf(Backpack backpack)
        Check whether the given backpack is a direct or indirect parent backpack of this backpack.
        Parameters:
        backpack - the parent backpack to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given backpack is a direct or indirect parent backpack of this backpack. Return false otherwise.
            result == (backpack == this.getParentBackpack() ||
             this.getParentBackpack().getParentBackpack().isDirectOrIndirectSubBackpackOf(backpack))

      • getItems

        @Raw
public java.util.Set<Item> getItems()
        Return a set with all the items of this backpack.
        Returns:
        Return a set with all the items of this backpack.

      • hasProperItems

        @Raw
public boolean hasProperItems()
        Check whether this backpack has proper items.
        Returns:
        Return true when this backpack can have each item in this backpack and the parentBackpack of this item is this backpack. Return false otherwise.
            for each (Item item : getItems())
             (canHaveAsItem(item) && item.getParentBackpack() == this)

      • changeValue

        public void changeValue(int amount)
        Change the own value of a backpack.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of change, positive if an increase is wished for, negative if the value should be decreased
        Postcondition:
        The value of the backpack is set to the sum of the old value and the given amount. The result is then clamped, to make sure it lies between the value boundaries.
            new.getValue() == MathHelper.clamp(old.getValue() + amount, getMinValue(), getMaxValue())

      • getTotalWeight

        @Raw
public float getTotalWeight()
        Return the total weight of this backpack.
        Specified by:
        getTotalWeight in interface Container
        Returns:
        Return the total weight of this backpack, this is calculated using the own weight of this backpack and the weight of all descendants in this backpack.
            result == sum ({item in getItems() :
             if (item.isContainer()) then ((Container)(item)).getTotalWeight()
             else item.getWeight()
             })

      • getTotalValue

        @Raw
public int getTotalValue()
        Return the total value of this purse.
        Specified by:
        getTotalValue in interface Container
        Returns:
        Return the total value of this purse in ducates.
            result == sum ({item in getItems() :
             if (item.isContainer()) then ((Container)(item)).getTotalValue()
             else item.getValue()
             })

      • getArmorCount

        public int getArmorCount()
        Return the amount of armors in this backpack.
        Returns:
        Return the amount of armors in this backpack also looks inside anchored backpacks.
            result == sum ({item in getItems() :
             if (item.isArmor()) then 1
             else ((Backpack)item).getArmorCount()
             })

      • getBestArmor

        public Armor getBestArmor()
        Return the best armor in a backpack.
        Returns:
        Return the best armor of a backpack.
            result.getFullProtection() == max ({item in getItems() :
             if (item.isArmor()) then ((Armor)item).getFullProtection()
             else ((Backpack)item).getBestArmor().getFullProtection()
             })

      • getBestWeapon

        public Weapon getBestWeapon()
        Return the best weapon in a backpack.
        Returns:
        Return the best weapon of a backpack.
            result.getDamage() == max ({item in getItems() :
             if (item.isWeapon()) then ((Weapon)item).getDamage()
             else ((Backpack)item).getBestWeapon().getDamage()
             })

      • getBestBackpack

        public Backpack getBestBackpack()
        Return the best backpack in a backpack.
        Returns:
        Return the best backpack of a backpack.
            result.getCapacity() == max ({item in getItems() :
             if (item.isBackpack()) then
             max ({((Backpack)item).getCapacity(), ((Backpack)item).getBestBackpack().getCapacity()})
             })

        Return a string containing all public data of this backpack.

        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Return a string containing all public data of this backpack.
